labels.label: 1.10) Create local SuccessLogMessage
Central notification response ERROR
3 versions of API-Maincontainers hosting 3 possible environments 1 DEV, 1 STAGE, 1 PROD
1.3) Extracting NGSI Masterdata - EntityID - EntityType - ServiceName
1.1) Central notification request receiver
Extract NGSI Masterdata ERROR
Create Response-Error-Attribute ERROR Create local errorfile in /tmp/nifierrors
1.6) Remote API call or JOLT transformation ERROR, No Response-Attribute available, Update Filename with Debug Info
1.7) Customization 1: NGSI-LD Context Broker access parameter Please change to your credentials BEST PRACTICE: Replace with secure Context Parameter
1.12) Keep-alive generator Create 1 file each 60min To keep system active
Remote API call + JOLT transformation OK, Response-Attribute available, Update Orion-LD
1.11) Create local errorfile with updated filename and with Response-Error-Attribute if available
1.9) Update Response Attribute in Orion-LD OK -> Auto-Termination Not OK -> Create local SuccessLogMessage or local errorfile
1.4) Flow routing based on environment parameter added to the notification url
1.8) Create Response- Error-Attribute with Debug Info
Create Response-Error-Attribute OK Update Orion-LD
RouteOn QueryParam Environment ERROR
1.2) Central notification response sender
Update Response Attribute in Orion-LD OK Create local errorfile in /tmp/nifierrors
Update Response Attribute in Orion-LD ERROR Create local errorfile in /tmp/nifierrors
1.5) SPLIT on whether successful JOLT transformations having created a Response-Attribute or not. Yes -> Send response to Orion-LD No -> ERROR -> Create a Response-Error-Attribut

config.comments:
The Notifications from OrionLD are catched from here: https://nifi1.fiware-dataspace-connector.org/input/dev?provider=XXX
Filter is path /input/dev.*
XXX is the Routing Parameter and can be i.e. Flixbus or Skedgo

The Notifications from OrionLD are catched from here: https://nifi1.fiware-dataspace-connector.org/input/dev?provider=XXX
Filter is path /input/dev.*
XXX is the Routing Parameter and can be i.e. Flixbus or Skedgo

labels.label: 2.1) Customization 2: Flow routing based on provider parameter added to the notification url
3.4) MIME Type extraction For decision about decompression
3.8) General JOLT Transformations
3.2) Customization 4: Flow routing based on ServiceName listed in self-created ServiceNameGroups
3.5) Content decomression if MIME Type indicates compression
3.6) Customization 5: Edit a) general and b) specific JSON JOLT Transformations
3.1) Customization 3: Details for Provider APIs BEST PRACTICE: Replace sensitive values with secure Context Parameter
3.3) Flow routing based on ResponseCode
3.7) Call-specific JOLT Transformations
4.1) Customization 6: Flow routing based on ServiceName equals ServiceName

5) Customization 7:
Preparation of individual call Flow routing based on ResponseCode - EvaluateJsonPath - ServiceAttributes -> Read individual data and parameter for remote call from query object and store them in Flow Attributes - ? ReplaceText (Optional) -> Create payload text for POST/PUT/PATCH calls and store them in Flow File (not for GET/DELETE calls ) - XXX (i.e. POST, GET...) - Invoke Remote HTTP Call -> Invoke Remote HTTP Call as defined with constructed URL and Headers and using payload from Replace Text if payload is needed - ? ReplaceText (Optional) -> Create payload text from response object, i.e. if desired data is delivered in a response header and store them in Flow File

config.comments:
The Notifications from OrionLD are catched from here: https://nifi1.fiware-dataspace-connector.org/input/dev?provider=XXX
Filter is path /input/dev.*
XXX is the Routing Parameter and can be i.e. Flixbus or Skedgo

Results from different APIs will be written to response-XXX-XXX-Attributes.
If such attributes exists, all processes must have been successful -> send directly to Orion-LD.
If not, there must have been some kind of error. -> Create a responst-XXX-XXX-Error-Attribute -> send to OrionLD.
Filename is updated separately to have some Debug Info even if the Response-Error-Attribute generation fails

processors.name: 1.6) Error: Update Filename with Debug Info

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

config.comments:
The Notifications from OrionLD are caught from here: https://nifi1.fiware-dataspace-connector.org/input?provider=XXX&environment=XXX
HTTPS is terminated in Kubernetes Ingress (no local certificates necessary) and traffic is routed to internal HTTP Port 8081 and the path is /input.*
